text:
Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg has expressed disappointment with Telecom Regulatory Authority of India’s decision to back Net Neutrality saying this restricts programmes of his and other organisations that provide free access to data.

However, the 31-year-old said he would not give up on breaking down connectivity barriers in India which he described as an important goal for his company. — PTI
title: Disappointing, says Zuckerberg
